history.content:
Summer classes are roughly twice as fast and intense as classes during the regular semester. As such, summer 61C + 70 would be equivalent to four intense technicals in a normal semester. I would highly recommend you don't do this, and delay one of those two to this fall. I've taken summer CS 70, and another difficult class on top of that would have been unmanageable. Do you need both classes to declare the major?

OP here. Unfortunately, I do need both classes to declare the major. I'm currently in my 2nd semester sophomore year, so after this semester the requirements to change majors increase.

——

That sounds insane unless you’ve taken discrete math and probability before. It would be the equivalent of taking 4 techs if you could handle that.

---

Did 61BL and 70. Definitely doable (both A's), but took approximately 12-14 hours of work, 7 days a week, and took a huge mental toll on me. Also lucked out on helpful 61BL TAs who saved me.

children.subject: For EECS, you need to have taken N lower-div EECS classes in N semesters to be able to declare (if N <= 4).  @4338
I took 61C and 70 as a fall-semester junior. Why do you need 61C to declare...? Only 61A, 61B and 70 are declaration requirements.

history.content: So far I've taken 61A and 61B, and I want to switch into EECS, but this is my 4th semester. If I take 61C and 70 over the summer, I will be able to declare EECS before my 5th semester. Do those two courses over summer sound doable?
history.subject: Summer Courseload: CS 61C + CS 70
